alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:48PM CDT until July 15 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 1148 PM CDT, The heaviest rain has ended, but radar estimates between 3 and 4 inches of rain fell in parts of eastern Franklin County. Areas of flash flooding will remain possible through early Saturday morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West Frankfort, Benton, Thompsonville and Hanaford. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
